title: Understanding spontaneous vaporization
text: For a process to occur spontaneously, the change in Gibbs free energy (ΔG) should be less than zero (negative).

title: Gibbs Free Energy
text: The formula for Gibbs free energy change is $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$, where ΔH is the change in enthalpy, T is the temperature in Kelvin, and ΔS is the change in entropy.

title: Substituting given values
text: Given that $$ΔH=40.67$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ and $$ΔS=109.3$$ J/K•mol (convert this to kJ/K•mol for consistency), and $$T=350$$ K, substitute these values into the formula for ΔG.

title: Calculating gibbs free energy change
text: Calculate whether the Gibbs free energy change is negative using the formula $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$.

title: Determining spontaneity from ΔG
text: If ΔG is negative, the process will be spontaneous. Check your calculation from the last step.

text: Based on your calculation of ΔG, will water vaporize spontaneously at $$350$$ K?
